revised_title: Investigations of Vapour-Pressures of Solids and Liquids
tldr: The author conducts experiments on the vapour-pressures of solids and liquids, specifically ice, camphor, benzene, acetic acid, and water. They find that the vapour-pressure of a solid is less than that of a liquid at the same temperature, and that these differences can be calculated from thermic data. The author also introduces a new method for determining the vapour-pressures of solids and liquids.
